text: Wow I never knew that existed, that is awesome :smile: Thank you very much!

Hi all - wondering if somebody can help me with a solution! A client has requested a bespoke labelling system for their blog index page. They want to be able to label their blogs with the type of content it is, for example a Q&A blog would have the colour-coordinated label 'Q&A' and a Podcast post would have the label 'Podcast'.

So far, we've tried using blog tags as a solution. By displaying HubSpot tags on the blog post itself, it did create a label - however, we're unable to control the ordering of tags in HubSpot, so as soon as we added more than 1 tag to a blog post it would bring through the wrong tag.

Is it possible to lock a field?
Specifically I want to update a field (widget) on blog-posts, through the API, but I don’t want this field to be editable from the blog-editor.
Yes. Is it a module field or a tag?
It’s a module field likes this `{% text "custom_field" label="Number of custom things this blog post has", value="" %}`

Does anyone know if the Timeline v3 API allows updating custom properties on `Companies` and `Deals` not just `Contacts`? I'm looking to use Timeline Events to provide a better integration with our product for our Sales Reps and Marketing Managers, but every time I try to map a token to a custom property on a Company I get the error "...is not enabled to be set as a company property."
It seems to work if the event template is associated with a `Contact` object, but not `Company`

Yep :slightly_smiling_face: Slack has the ability to create workflows that you can use for paid instances: <https://slackhq.com/automate-tasks-in-slack-with-workflow-builder>
if your team is on a paid slack plan, I highly encourage looking at them, they are pretty nice.

interesting….. i just found out if the delay is over 19000, it terminates the chatflow. a delay of 19000 works fine. you also can’t precede it with a chat bubble, because the delay will fire before the bubble. but a question works fine.
Thanks for following up, I’ll file an issue to see what we can get documented around delays. I anticipate you won’t be the only person who wants something like this
Thanks Zack!

<@UFBNA9K9A> another thing i’m finding is that i can’t do if/then branches off of my quickReplies. The buttons show up, but their values don’t show up in the if/then panel. Even if I write them into the branch values, the snippet just reloads itself with the two buttons over and over. I’m using “Yes” and “No,” so it should have been easy.
happy to send you my code to duplicate and mess with, if you want. it’s pretty basic
yeah If you could DM me what you are looking at I’d definitely like to take a look. I’m having a hard time picturing exactly what you are describing

add this `

What did you end up doing?

Hey <@U01287TL4R0>
Thanks again for all the feedback on the call today.

We do allow property stamping on all default properties, but I was able to reproduce your case of not being able to handle custom properties for Deals and Companies.

It looks like we're specifically validating for that case, so let me gather some more info and see if there's a reason we put that limitation in place.

So it looks like the restriction we put in place was out of date. I was able to use custom deal/company properties when I lifted the restriction.
You should be all set to try this again.

Thanks again for pointing this out!
Awesome! I’ll give this a try tomorrow
